availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Van Winkle (Wayne Co state rep)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Wayne County native. Son of Micajah Van Winkle and Mary Phillips Van Winkle. Married to Mary Buster Van Winkle on January 21, 1858. Studied law with Ephraim L. Van Winkle in 1852. Graduated from law school at the University of Louisville in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1854. Attorney in Monticello, Kentucky, in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Wayne County from 1861 to 1863. Practiced law in Danville, Kentucky, from 1863 to 1866.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Monticello, p. 2; Office of the Kentucky Secretary of State, "Secretary of State John S. Van Winkle," apps.sos.ky.gov/secdesk/sosinfo/default.aspx?id=40 (accessed November 22, 2017); Find A Grave, "John Sallee VanWinkle (1829-1888)," Memorial #40846871, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40846871 (accessed November 22, 2017).
